title: 14-Year-Old, 18-Year-Old Killed in Shooting After Party in Capitol Heights
content:
A 14-year-old boy and 18-year-old man were fatally shot and four other people were wounded after someone opened fire Sunday after a party in Capitol Heights, Maryland.
The victims were shot on the 6800 block of Walker Mill Road, Prince George's County Police said. Officers found the victims in a parking lot when they arrived at the scene about 2:45 a.m.
Brian Davis, 18, of Northwest D.C. was killed, along with Todd James Webb Jr., 14, of Capitol Heights, police said.
Of the four surviving shooting victims, two remain in a hospital, police said. One man has life-threatening injuries; the other person is expected to survive.
Two other people were treated at a hospital and released.
No information was released immediately on what preceded the shooting. No suspects have been arrested.
Police are offering a reward of up to $25,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment.
Anyone with information about this case is asked to call police at 301-772-4925. Callers wishing to remain anonymous may call Crime Solvers at 1-866-411-TIPS (8477), text "PGPD" plus their message to CRIMES (274637) , or go to www.pgcrimesolvers.com to submit a tip online.
